question: In which Indian state the Arjuna Sahayak irrigation project is being implemented?
explanation:
The Arjuna Sahayak irrigation is being implemented by the Government of Uttar Pradesh on the river Dhasan.
The estimated cost of the project is Rs.2,600 crore and is scheduled to be completed in this year. It is expected to irrigate more than 1.5 lakh farmers and provide water to 168 villages of the state.
